page.title: 12Worksop Manor Building
page.content: The 4th Duke of Newcastle left only the stable yard and the foundations, converting one wing to a modest home.In 1890 the 7th Duke sold it to Sir John Robinson and his great _ nephew, Capt. Farr, whose family still own it. The large Stable Yard has a triumphal arch at one end with a cupola crowned archway at the other. This leads through into the grand court to the front of the Manor. The ground floor designed by Paine acts as an impressive garden wall. The wall is crowned with the urns which were on the top of the demolished building . This, with the triumphal arch and many Doric columns, bring to mind past glory. The great pediment (designed by the Duchess and carved by Collins) has been rebuilt and stands in the hen-run.
